Original_Text: SAN FRANCISCO - A tech company unveiled a new AI-powered platform to streamline corporate workflows, promising a 20 percent boost in productivity.
LONDON - A financial institution announced a $500 million investment in green energy projects to support sustainable development across Europe.
TOKYO - A leading electronics company launched a next-generation wearable device with advanced health monitoring features.
NEW YORK - A retail company reported a 10 percent drop in quarterly profits due to supply chain disruptions but remains optimistic about holiday sales.
SYDNEY - A biotech company secured regulatory approval for a groundbreaking gene therapy treatment, boosting its stock by 15 percent.
CHICAGO - A major insurance institution revised its risk models to incorporate climate change impacts, affecting premiums nationwide.
HONG KONG - A logistics company partnered with a tech startup to deploy autonomous delivery drones in urban areas.
BOSTON - A pharmaceutical company announced a merger with a smaller biotech firm to accelerate cancer research.
TORONTO - A telecom company expanded its fiber-optic network, aiming to connect 1 million rural households by 2026.
MUMBAI - An energy company acquired a wind farm operator for $1.5 billion to bolster its renewable energy portfolio.
